timeline.bodyText:
((Long) delta[0]).intValue()
Just cast the object to an integer ?
timeline.author: Matocolotoe

replies.bodyText:
You want to cast it to a Number, not a Long
Also, what if I set the strength to -10? Does that work? Sometimes IllegalArgumentExceptions will be thrown for numbers out of range, so please check that if you can 🙂
replies.author: APickledWalrus

replies.bodyText: It told me it couldn't cast a Long to an Integer
replies.author: DeltaRays

replies.bodyText: When I casted delta[0] to an integer it told me it couldn’t cast a long to an integer. Don’t worry, I’ve fixed it
replies.author: DeltaRays

replies.bodyText: Of course but I'm talking about the original object... Nevermind.
replies.author: Matocolotoe

timeline.message: Updated a few names and added trident support

timeline.author: APickledWalrus

timeline.bodyText:
You should cast to Number, not Long 🙂
Also, how are values < 0 handled? Do they work?
timeline.author: APickledWalrus

timeline.message:
Knockback strength doesn't work for tridents :-/
You're right, values < 0 return errors so I used Math.max

timeline.bodyText: You might be better off checking if strength < 0 and just not doing anything, but that’s up for debate: should setting it to a negative value set it to no strength? Personally I don’t think it should do anything, but others may disagree.
timeline.author: APickledWalrus
APickledWalrus
FranKusmiruk
FranKusmiruk
FranKusmiruk
FranKusmiruk

timeline.message: Fixed copyright issues and added REMOVE and ADD to ExprArrowKnockbackStrength
Removed Math.max to allow removing negative values and made setting the damage to a negative value not do anything
